input.description: This username overrides the value specified in the config.
This password overrides the value specified in the config.
Severity of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - Normal - Warning - Minor - Major - Critical
Specifies the DnsName (Node Name) of the message.
Specifies the category (Message Group) of the message.
Specifies Application of the message.
Specifies Object of the message.
Specifies configuration item of the message.
Specifies the correlation key of the message.
Specifies the escalation status of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - notEscalated - Escalated
Specifies the condition matched of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - true - false

Specifies the received time of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : Received time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).

Specifies the received time comparator of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : Received time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).

state-change-time[Optional] Specifies the state change time of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : State change time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).

Specifies the state change time comparator of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - at - - from - to - since Note : State change time should follow the following Format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS When comparator "since" is used then the format should be xh or xd or xw where x is any valid number and h stands for hour(s), d stands for day(s) and w stands for week(s).
title[Optional] Specifies the Title of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - exactly - for exact match - contains - for contains
Specifies the title comparator of the message. Possible values for the Comparator could be as follows :- - exactly - for exact match - contains - for contains
Specifies the key for the custom attribute of the message.
Specifies the Text for the custom attribute of the message.

Specifies the owner of the message. Possible values could be as follows :- - any - Specifies the message(es) owned by any anyone. - none - Specifies the message(es) not owned by anyone. - self - Specifies the message(es) owned by the current user. Current User will be the user specified at Request level else will be the user specified at adapter configuration. - others - Specifies the message(es) not owned by the current user.
Specifies the life cycle state of the message.

Specifies the comparision logic between the given parameters. Possible values for the comparator could be as follows :- - or - for using logical or between all the given parameters. - and - for using logical and between all the given parameters. It is the default value.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <xsl:if test="string-length('${username}') != 0"> <username> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${username}</xsl:text> </username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${password}') != 0"> <password> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${password}</xsl:text> </password> </xsl:if> <arguments> <xsl:if test="string-length('${severity}') != 0"> <severity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${severity}</xsl:text> </severity> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${dns name}') != 0"> <dns-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${dns name}</xsl:text> </dns-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${category}') != 0"> <category> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${category}</xsl:text> </category> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${application}') != 0"> <application> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${application}</xsl:text> </application> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${object}') != 0"> <object> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${object}</xsl:text> </object> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${configuration item}') != 0"> <configuration-item> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${configuration item}</xsl:text> </configuration-item> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${correlation key}') != 0"> <correlation-key> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${correlation key}</xsl:text> </correlation-key> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${escalation status}') != 0"> <escalation-status> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${escalation status}</xsl:text> </escalation-status> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${condition matched}') != 0"> <condition-matched> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${condition matched}</xsl:text> </condition-matched> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${received time}') != 0 and string-length('${received time comparator}') != 0"> <reveived-time comparator="${received time comparator}"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${received time}</xsl:text> </reveived-time> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${state change time}') != 0 and string-length('${state change time comparator}') != 0"> <state-change-time comparator="${state change time comparator}"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${severity}</xsl:text> </state-change-time> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${title}') !=0 and string-length('${title comparator}') !=0 "> <title comparator="${title comparator}"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${title}</xsl:text> </title> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${custom attribute key}') != 0 and string-length('${custom attribute text}}') != 0"> <custom-attributes> <custom-attribute> <key> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${custom attribute key}</xsl:text> </key> <text> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${custom attribute text}</xsl:text> </text> </custom-attribute> </custom-attributes> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${owner}') != 0"> <owner> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${owner}</xsl:text> </owner> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${life cycle state}') != 0"> <life-cycle-state> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${life cycle state}</xsl:text> </life-cycle-state> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${comparator}') != 0"> <comparator> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${comparator}</xsl:text> </comparator> </xsl:if> </arguments> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for Find Message process.
